conclusion: Problem involves a stationary metal rod MN on parallel rails in a magnetic field with given parameters.
Need to find the magnitude of the Ampere force on the rod and the resistance value of R2.
Two parallel rails with a distance of 15 cm between them, metal rod MN is stationary, magnetic field is vertically upwards with magnitude 0.6 T.
Rod has mass of 17 g and resistance R1 of 4 ohms, sliding rheostat R2 connected in series, power source with electromotive force E of 10 V and internal resistance r of 1 ohm.
Switch S is closed, rod remains stationary.
Ampere force on a current-carrying conductor in a magnetic field is given by F = BIL.
F is the force in newtons, B is the magnetic field strength in teslas, I is the current in amperes, L is the length of the conductor in meters.
Need to find current I and length L to calculate force F.
Distance between rails is 15 cm, but length L of rod perpendicular to field might be different due to angles.
Diagram shows angles of 30 degrees where rails are inclined.
Length L of rod perpendicular to field is distance between rails divided by cosine of angle between rod and field.
Magnetic field is vertical, rod inclined at 30 degrees to horizontal, component of field perpendicular to rod is B sin(30°).
Angle between field and rod is 90 degrees minus angle of inclination, which is 60 degrees.
Effective magnetic field component perpendicular to rod is B sin(60°).
Force is F = B I L sin(60°), where θ is angle between field and current.
Need to find F in terms of known quantities, know B and can find sin(60°), need to find L.
Express L in terms of distance between rails, which is 0.15 meters.
